Choose one of the following: ES112, HIST206, HIST216, ISLA123, JOUR219, JOUR228, RELS201, WGQS201, WGQS210.

Required in Major or Support; some courses also satisfy a General Education (GE) requirement or the USCP.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, Lower-Division E, F, and GE Elective (8). Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Area D Elective, Upper-Division D, or E.

Choose one of the following: STAT130, STAT217, or STAT218.

Required in Major or Support; some courses also satisfy a General Education (GE) requirement or the USCP.

Any GE Upper-Division STAT course may be substituted to fulfill this major requirement. Non-GE courses teaching statistical or quantitative analysis methods may be substituted to satisfy this requirement but only with the consent of the ISLA Department Chair. In those cases, students will then have to take an additional course to satisfy the GE requirement.

Choose one of the following: COMS213, COMS322, COMS385; ENGL311, ENGL312, ENGL317, ENGL467; PSY304.

Required in Major or Support; some courses also satisfy a General Education (GE) requirement or the USCP.

If a course is taken to meet the Communication Course or Upper-Division Electives requirement, it cannot be double-counted in the Concentration. Please consult with academic advisor.

Any Sustainability & Global Environment Track course can go here.

To ensure an interdisciplinary course of study, courses chosen should from at least two different disciplines (as indicated by distinct course prefixes) and no more than half of them can have the same course prefix. The student is responsible for checking prerequisites for all courses. See catalog for more concentration details.
